TopicTitle: When did you buy KSP? (I want to know how many people waited for it to come out of Early Access)

Articles.Content: I got it a little while after 0.16 was released. Best 18 bucks I've spent on gaming since Minecraft

It makes me wonder if Squad have reached saturation... if everyone who might be interesting in getting the game has already bought it.

From what I understand they were hoping to have an influx of new players with 1.0, but... is there still a target audience left? Of course, it's possible there are plenty of players who are interested in 1.0, but they just don't hang out on the forum.

> 
> It makes me wonder if Squad have reached saturation... if everyone who might be interesting in getting the game has already bought it.
> From what I understand they were hoping to have an influx of new players with 1.0, but... is there still a target audience left? Of course, it's possible there are plenty of players who are interested in 1.0, but they just don't hang out on the forum.

I don't think that KSP has reached user saturation yet.

There's a lot of potential buyers that never heard about pre-release games, and that doesn't know what steam is (other than the form of water coming from their kettle every morning).

KSP is a true 6-99 game, possibly breaking that definition in both ends,

Don't underestimate the 50-60+.

We have more spare time (kids have moved out), more money (live with it youngins) and don't have to adapt to any group or community.

How long do you think it will be before personal (game quality) computers and a decent downline is critical for any form care for the elderly? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
June 2012 .. something around that time. 1300+ gaming hours on KSP till that day ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Wanna say I bought it late 2012 early 2013
I bought it just before the great forum crash which wasn't really helping me out at all. Then I found Scott's videos.
last friday, as to save 10 bucks.
Not soon enough. Hence my grief and coffee thread of old.

I bought version 0.17. Couple of weeks(?) later 0.18 hit with docking, new planets\moons and other awesome stuff ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif) Best decision in this gamer life. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

February 2012

But I started playing it in january, I think. No map existed back then, it was still glorious.

Now I feel kinda bad, that I only paid 10$ for such a polished piece of art. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Way back in the good old days when landing on the dark side of a non-rotating Kerbin made your craft explode.
I bought it in June of 2013, about an hour after I started playing the demo. I want to say it was 0.18, but don't quote me on that.
.17 version.
I think I bought it around 0.15

April 8th 2012 (v0.14) after a friend convinced me to get it and we've been playing it ever since. Logged 500hrs in steam and that's nit counting the year I played before switching to steam. Felt a little sad when 1.0 came out that this long journey was coming to an end been an amazing ride. Looking forward to future updates.

KSP is a shinning example of what a Pre-Release game should be. No one ever follows trough as thoroughly as Squad has or has more updates.

Been 3 years since I started this, reminds me of this quote:

 **"My journey is the same as yours, the same as anyone's. It's taken me so many years, so many lifetimes, but at last I know where I'm going. Where I've always been going. Home. The long way round." 11th Doctor.**

I feel that we've finally arrived home, congratulations to Squad for the release!
